intro: Crescentia regia, commonly known as the sacred lotus of Mexico, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and striking white or pink flowers that bloom at night. The plant produces a unique, elongated fruit that resembles a trumpet, containing edible seeds. Crescentia regia thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Bombacaceae family.
